verses.verse: Praise to God Who Comes in Judgment (1 Chr 16.23-33) O sing to the LORD a new song; sing to the LORD, all the earth.
(Ps 71.15) Sing to the LORD; bless his name; tell of his salvation from day to day.
(Ps 145.12) Declare his glory among the nations, his marvelous works among all the peoples.
(Ps 18.3; 95.3; 145.3) For great is the LORD and greatly to be praised; he is to be revered above all gods.
(1 Chr 16.26; Ps 115.15) For all the gods of the peoples are idols, but the LORD made the heavens.
(Ps 104.1) Honor and majesty are before him; strength and beauty are in his sanctuary.
(Ps 29.1, 2) Ascribe to the LORD, O families of the peoples, ascribe to the LORD glory and strength.
(Ps 79.9) Ascribe to the LORD the glory due his name; bring an offering, and come into his courts.
(Ps 29.2) Worship the LORD in holy splendor; tremble before him, all the earth.
(Ps 67.4; 93.1) Say among the nations, “The LORD is king! The world is firmly established; it shall never be moved. He will judge the peoples with equity.”
(Ps 97.1; 98.7) Let the heavens be glad, and let the earth rejoice; let the sea roar and all that fills it;
let the field exult and everything in it. Then shall all the trees of the forest sing for joy
(Ps 67.4; Rev 19.11) before the LORD, for he is coming, for he is coming to judge the earth. He will judge the world with righteousness and the peoples with his truth.
